content: Martin Ziegler Martin Ziegler (CV) Research Area: Computer Science for Continuous Data Email: rk.ca.tsiak@relgeiz; public PGP key Office: KAIST School of Computing, N1 #506 Phone: +82-42-350-3568 Short CV: 11.11.2002: PhD defense in Computer Science at Paderborn University 2003-2004: Post-doc in DFG Graduiertenkolleg 693   "PaSCo" 2005: Guest lecturer at the University of Southern Denmark; host: Klaus Meer 2006: von Humboldt fellow (JSPS scholarship) at Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology; host: 石原 哉 2007: visiting scholar at the Korea Institute for Advanced Study; host: 박형주 2008: Habilitation at the University of Paderborn 2008: Visiting Associate at the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST); host: 정지원 2009: DFG Heisenberg-Scholar at the Technical University of Vienna, Department of Theoretical Physics; host: Karl Svozil 2010-2015: Associate Professor (W2) at the Department of Mathematics, Technische Universität Darmstadt 2011-2015: elected member of the Faculty Council (re-elected 2013) 2012-2015: Speaker of IANUS: Interdisziplinäre Arbeitsgruppe Naturwissenschaft und Sicherheit Feb+Mar.2013: Visiting Researcher at the Graduate School of Information Science and Technology, University of Tokyo; host: 河村彰星 Oct.2013: elected to the university convention ("Universitätsversammlung" plus "Senatsausschuß Lehre") 2014~2021: steering committee of the Deutsche Vereinigung för Mathematische Logik und für Grundlagenforschung der Exakten Wissenschaften (DVMLG) Programme committee chair of the 12th International Conference on Computability and Complexity in Analysis (Tokyo'15) since 2015: professor of theoretical computer science at KAIST 2016~2024: council of the Association Computability in Europe 2020~2021: KAIST International Faculty Council See below for Awards, Projects, Publications, Group, Teaching, Memberships, Service Talks, and Miscellaneous. Honours and Awards: Preis für herausragende Abschlußarbeiten 1996/97 der Uni-GH Paderborn for the Diploma Thesis "Eine alternative Formulierung der Quantenmechanik". Multimedia Award 1998 founded by the German Ministry of Economy and Technology (BMWi) (jointly with Matthias Fischer and Tamás Lukovszki) for project Multimediale Entdeckungsreisen unserer Welt mit dem Internet Forschungspreis 2006 (jointly with Dr. Matthias Fischer) Best Paper at the 32nd Annual Conference on Artificial Intelligence (2009) for joint work with Florentin Neumann and Andrea Reichenberger: "Variations of the Turing Test in the Age of Internet and Virtual Reality" Athene Fachbereichspreis für Gute Lehre und Sonderpreis für Interdisziplinäre Lehre 2011 (gem. mit Gerd Buntkowsky und Hans-Jürgen Bär) JSPS BRIDGE Fellow 2013 (held 9 lectures at 4 academic institutions within 1 month in Japan) Report on Science Circle (Wissenschaftlicher Gesprächskreis, WGK), pp.144-146 in Festschrift on the occasion of the 20th Anniversary of German-Japanese Scientific Exchange (2015) Computer Science Colloquium Organizer (fall 2016) Projects Real Hypercomputation (DFG, full position, 2005-2009) Computability and Computational Complexity of Physical Theories (DFG, Heisenberg Fellowship, 2009-2010) German counterpart to Royal Society International Exchange Grant IE111233 (2012-2014) Host of TSUKAMOTO Yasuyuki (DAAD, 2014) Quantitative uniforme Komplexitätstheorie mehrwertiger reeller Funktionen und Operatoren in Analysis, DFG Zi 1009/4 funding Carsten Rösnick (Apr.2013-Feb.2015) and Matthias Schröder (Dez.2014-Jan.2016) German-Japanese Workshop on Theory and Practice of Real Computation supported in part by the German Research and Innovation Forum - Tokyo.
